body:
Hello @simonjayhawkins! Thanks for updating the PR.





Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on February 10, 2019 at 21:43 Hours UTC

> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24841?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [5f73594...cd63aa5](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24841?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

OK. so considering that this bug has such a simple workaround that it is unlikely to be a real issue to most users then i think the best way forward here is to _also_ include an api change in _this_ PR and defer to 0.25.

if I add a `max_colwidth` parameter to `to_html` that just takes an non-negative int (to be consistent with the `max_cols` and `max_rows` parameters of `to_html`), users prefering the current (incorrect) behaviour could then just use `to_html(max_colwidth=pd.options.display.max_colwidth)`

i think issue #17004 could then be considered fully closed.
